content:
Add a Currency Input Element to a FlexCard

Add a Currency Input element on a FlexCard to enable users to enter a currency amount based on the locale and currency type you specify. From the Properties panel, configure properties and custom attributes, add an action, and add conditions.

Available beginning Winter '22.

From the FlexCards tab, click a version of a FlexCard to open the FlexCard Designer.
From the Build panel, click Inputs, and drag the Currency element onto the canvas.
Configure properties common to all Input elements:

* Field Binding: bind the value of the input element to an existing or new data field
* Field Label: enter the label that appears next to the element
* Placeholder: enter temporary text that displays inside the input field
* Required: check if the user must enter or select a value for this input element
* Read-only: disable the ability to modify the input values
* Help Text: enter helpful text about the purpose of the input field
* Default Value: select a default input value from a merge field or enter a value as plain text
* Locale: update the locale for the currency
* Currency Code: update the type of currency

Click + Add New in the Custom Attributes section to configure additional properties. For each new attribute, perform the following tasks:
* Select an attribute from the dropdown.
* Enter a value for the attribute.

To execute an action when a user interacts with the input element, click + Add Action and see Add a Click Event to a FlexCard Element.

To add conditions that must be met for the element to display, see Add Conditions to a FlexCard Element.

To style your element, click Style to open the Style panel and see Style FlexCard Elements.
title: Adding Currency Input Element in FlexCards
